flawed_nl_solution:
Today, 5 bottles of $20 wine will cost 5*20 = $<<5*20=1000>>1000
In 2 months there will be a 25% tariff on the 5 bottles of wine that cost $1000 so that makes the 5 bottles 0.25*1000 = $250 more expensive
#### 250

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 100, not 1000. It appears an extra zero was added to the number.
